title: Attila the Hun sacks the town of Metz and attacks other cities in Gaul.
text: • 451 – Attila the Hun sacks the town of Metz and attacks other cities in Gaul.

title: First draft of the Corpus Juris Civilis (a fundamental work in jurisprudence) is issued by Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I.
text: • 529 – First draft of the Corpus Juris Civilis (a fundamental work in jurisprudence) is issued by Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I.

title: Maya king Uneh Chan of Calakmul sacks rival city
text: • 611 – Maya king Uneh Chan of Calakmul sacks rival city-state Palenque in southern Mexico.

title: Empress Matilda became the first female ruler of England, adopting the title 'Lady of the English'.
text: • 1141 – Empress Matilda became the first female ruler of England, adopting the title 'Lady of the English'.

title: Charles University is founded in Prague.
text: • 1348 – Charles University is founded in Prague.

title: Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Cebu.
text: • 1521 – Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Cebu.

title: Francis Xavier leaves Lisbon on a mission to the Portuguese East Indies.
text: • 1541 – Francis Xavier leaves Lisbon on a mission to the Portuguese East Indies.

title: Premiere performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's St John Passion BWV 245 at St. Nicholas Church, Leipzig.
text: • 1724 – Premiere performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's St John Passion BWV 245 at St. Nicholas Church, Leipzig.

title: End of Burmese
text: • 1767 – End of Burmese–Siamese War (1765–67).

title: Captain John Barry and the USS Lexington captures the Edward.
text: • 1776 – Captain John Barry and the USS Lexington captures the Edward.

title: American pioneers to the Northwest Territory establish Marietta, Ohio as the first permanent American settlement in the Northwest Territory.
text: • 1788 – American pioneers to the Northwest Territory establish Marietta, Ohio as the first permanent American settlement in the Northwest Territory.

title: Selim III became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.
text: • 1789 – Selim III became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.

title: The Mississippi Territory is organized from disputed territory claimed by both the United States and Spain. It is expanded in 1804 and again in 1812.
text: • 1798 – The Mississippi Territory is organized from disputed territory claimed by both the United States and Spain. It is expanded in 1804 and again in 1812.

title: Lewis and Clark Expedition: The Corps of Discovery breaks camp among the Mandan tribe and resumes its journey West along the Missouri River.
text: • 1805 – Lewis and Clark Expedition: The Corps of Discovery breaks camp among the Mandan tribe and resumes its journey West along the Missouri River.

title: German composer Ludwig van Beethoven premiered his Third Symphony, at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna.
text: • 1805 – German composer Ludwig van Beethoven premiered his Third Symphony, at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna.

title: John Walker, an English chemist, sells the first friction match that he had invented the previous year.
text: • 1827 – John Walker, an English chemist, sells the first friction match that he had invented the previous year.

title: Joseph Smith, founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, commences translation of the Book of Mormon, with Oliver Cowdery as his scribe.
text: • 1829 – Joseph Smith, founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, commences translation of the Book of Mormon, with Oliver Cowdery as his scribe.

title: Emperor Pedro I of Brazil resigns. He goes to his native Portugal to become King Pedro IV.
text: • 1831 – Emperor Pedro I of Brazil resigns. He goes to his native Portugal to become King Pedro IV.

title: American Civil War: The Union's Army of the Tennessee and the Army of the Ohio defeat the Confederate Army of Mississippi near Shiloh, Tennessee.
text: • 1862 – American Civil War: The Union's Army of the Tennessee and the Army of the Ohio defeat the Confederate Army of Mississippi near Shiloh, Tennessee.

title: Thomas D'Arcy McGee, one of the Canadian Fathers of Confederation, is assassinated by a Fenian activist.
text: • 1868 – Thomas D'Arcy McGee, one of the Canadian Fathers of Confederation, is assassinated by a Fenian activist.

title: Completion of the first Lake Biwa Canal.
text: • 1890 – Completion of the first Lake Biwa Canal.

title: Mount Vesuvius erupts and devastates Naples.
text: • 1906 – Mount Vesuvius erupts and devastates Naples.

title: The Algeciras Conference gives France and Spain control over Morocco.
text: • 1906 – The Algeciras Conference gives France and Spain control over Morocco.

title: H. H. Asquith of the Liberal Party takes office as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, succeeding Sir Henry Campbell
text: • 1908 – H. H. Asquith of the Liberal Party takes office as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, succeeding Sir Henry Campbell-Bannerman.

title: The United States Secretary of the Interior leases federal petroleum reserves to private oil companies on excessively generous terms.
text: • 1922 – The United States Secretary of the Interior leases federal petroleum reserves to private oil companies on excessively generous terms.

title: The first long
text: • 1927 – The first long-distance public television broadcast (from Washington, D.C., to New York City, displaying the image of Commerce Secretary Herbert Hoover).

title: Prohibition in the United States is repealed for beer of no more than 3.2% alcohol by weight, eight months before the ratification of the XXI amendment. (Now celebrated as National Beer Day in the United States.)
text: • 1933 – Prohibition in the United States is repealed for beer of no more than 3.2% alcohol by weight, eight months before the ratification of the XXI amendment. (Now celebrated as National Beer Day in the United States.)

title: Booker T. Washington becomes the first African American to be depicted on a United States postage stamp.
text: • 1940 – Booker T. Washington becomes the first African American to be depicted on a United States postage stamp.

title: The Holocaust in Ukraine: In Terebovlia, Germans order 1,100 Jews to undress and march through the city to the nearby village of Plebanivka, where they are shot and buried in ditches.
text: • 1943 – The Holocaust in Ukraine: In Terebovlia, Germans order 1,100 Jews to undress and march through the city to the nearby village of Plebanivka, where they are shot and buried in ditches.

title: Ioannis Rallis becomes collaborationist Prime Minister of Greece during the Axis Occupation.
text: • 1943 – Ioannis Rallis becomes collaborationist Prime Minister of Greece during the Axis Occupation.

title: World War II: The Yamato, one of the two largest battleships ever constructed, is sunk by American aircraft during Operation Ten
text: • 1945 – World War II: The Yamato, one of the two largest battleships ever constructed, is sunk by American aircraft during Operation Ten-Go.

title: World War II: Visoko is liberated by the 7th, 9th, and 17th Krajina brigades from the Tenth division of Yugoslav Partisan forces.
text: • 1945 – World War II: Visoko is liberated by the 7th, 9th, and 17th Krajina brigades from the Tenth division of Yugoslav Partisan forces.

title: Syria's independence from France is officially recognised.
text: • 1946 – Syria's independence from France is officially recognised.

title: The World Health Organization is established by the United Nations.
text: • 1948 – The World Health Organization is established by the United Nations.

title: The Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific opened on Broadway; it would run for 1,925 performances and win ten Tony Awards.
text: • 1949 – The Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific opened on Broadway; it would run for 1,925 performances and win ten Tony Awards.

title: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower gives his "domino theory" speech during a news conference.
text: • 1954 – United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower gives his "domino theory" speech during a news conference.

title: Winston Churchill resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom amid indications of failing health.
text: • 1955 – Winston Churchill resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom amid indications of failing health.

title: IBM announces the System/360.
text: • 1964 – IBM announces the System/360.

title: A bulldozer kills Rev. Bruce W. Klunder, a civil rights activist, during a school segregation protest in Cleveland, Ohio, sparking a riot.
text: • 1964 – A bulldozer kills Rev. Bruce W. Klunder, a civil rights activist, during a school segregation protest in Cleveland, Ohio, sparking a riot.

title: Motor racing world champion Jim Clark is killed in an accident during a Formula Two race at Hockenheim.
text: • 1968 – Motor racing world champion Jim Clark is killed in an accident during a Formula Two race at Hockenheim.

title: The Internet's symbolic birth date: Publication of RFC 1.
text: • 1969 – The Internet's symbolic birth date: Publication of RFC 1.

title: President Richard Nixon announces his decision to quicken the pace of Vietnamization.
text: • 1971 – President Richard Nixon announces his decision to quicken the pace of Vietnamization.

title: Member of Parliament and suspected spy John Stonehouse resigns from the Labour Party (UK) after being arrested for faking his own death.
text: • 1976 – Member of Parliament and suspected spy John Stonehouse resigns from the Labour Party (UK) after being arrested for faking his own death.

title: German Federal prosecutor Siegfried Buback and his driver are shot by two Red Army Faction members while waiting at a red light.
text: • 1977 – German Federal prosecutor Siegfried Buback and his driver are shot by two Red Army Faction members while waiting at a red light.

title: Development of the neutron bomb is canceled by President Jimmy Carter.
text: • 1978 – Development of the neutron bomb is canceled by President Jimmy Carter.

title: During the Iran hostage crisis, the United States severs relations with Iran.
text: • 1980 – During the Iran hostage crisis, the United States severs relations with Iran.

title: During STS
text: • 1983 – During STS-6, astronauts Story Musgrave and Don Peterson perform the first Space Shuttle spacewalk.

title: Soviet submarine Komsomolets sinks in the Barents Sea off the coast of Norway killing 42 sailors.
text: • 1989 – Soviet submarine Komsomolets sinks in the Barents Sea off the coast of Norway killing 42 sailors.

title: Iran
text: • 1990 – Iran–Contra affair: John Poindexter is found guilty of five charges for his part in the scandal (the conviction is later reversed on appeal).

title: A fire breaks out on the passenger ferry Scandinavian Star, killing 159 people.
text: • 1990 – A fire breaks out on the passenger ferry Scandinavian Star, killing 159 people.

title: Rwandan genocide: Massacres of Tutsis begin in Kigali, Rwanda.
text: • 1994 – Rwandan genocide: Massacres of Tutsis begin in Kigali, Rwanda.

title: Auburn Calloway attempts to destroy Federal Express Flight 705 in order to allow his family to benefit from his life insurance policy.
text: • 1994 – Auburn Calloway attempts to destroy Federal Express Flight 705 in order to allow his family to benefit from his life insurance policy.

title: First Chechen War: Russian paramilitary troops begin a massacre of civilians in Samashki, Chechnya.
text: • 1995 – First Chechen War: Russian paramilitary troops begin a massacre of civilians in Samashki, Chechnya.

title: The World Trade Organization rules in favor of the United States in its long
text: • 1999 – The World Trade Organization rules in favor of the United States in its long-running trade dispute with the European Union over bananas.

title: Mars Odyssey is launched.
text: • 2001 – Mars Odyssey is launched.

title: U.S. troops capture Baghdad; Saddam Hussein's regime falls two days later.
text: • 2003 – U.S. troops capture Baghdad; Saddam Hussein's regime falls two days later.

title: Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is sentenced to 25 years in prison for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces.
text: • 2009 – Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is sentenced to 25 years in prison for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces.

title: Mass protests begin across Moldova under the belief that results from the parliamentary election are fraudulent.
text: • 2009 – Mass protests begin across Moldova under the belief that results from the parliamentary election are fraudulent.

title: The 2017 Stockholm attack kills five and injures fifteen others.
text: • 2017 – The 2017 Stockholm attack kills five and injures fifteen others.
